reviews.review_msg: The professor was friendly and accessible through email if needed. Grading from my TA was really strict. What was looked for in assignments was not always clear. For the 2 major writing assignments (collectively 50% of your grade) the average mark was 13.5/20. Your grade seems to depend highly on what TA you get.

Awful. Unclear requirements for papers and terrible feedback given. No real reason provided for marks lost. Very biased and isn't afraid to show it. She uses her job as a way to indoctrinate her students. A fellow student pointed out a flaw in one of her beliefs and she proceeded to try and humiliate them infront of the class. Run away

other reviews are kinda harsh on the professor but by no means is she a good prof and should be avoided. Her views will upset some people and while I don't agree with them, I don't think should be contributing to her negative reviews
However, marking is a different story. I've never seen so much discrepancy in marking. She does not know to mark

While I respect Michaela as an accomplished person, I have an issue with her holding strong biases on controversial topics in a course designed to teach moral and legal problems. For example, she would make it clear that she is not educated or interested in sports, but will hold strong remarks and littered biases in discussion towards athletics.

It's funny because this professor tries to look or appear smart and intelligent by using all this fancy and obscure wording that often requires you to pull out a dictionary to actually understand what she is teaching.

Then, when you put it in your own words you get deducted marks because you are "missing essential elements"

What a joke of a prof

Corrupts and fries your developing brain into nonsense. You cannot develop your brain to think critically when she blasts propaganda in your face and penalizes you heavily if you ever muster the courage to disagree with her problematic and troubling views.

She spends the entire lecture ranting about off topic stuff or teaching that every single human HAS to be vegan, how apparently holding the door open for women is sexist?, and how trans athletes should choose if they want to compete with men or women. The quizzes and papers are graded tough and she gives snarky responses to student's questions

She literally reads off SLIDES every lecture, and what's amazing is that she does not post lecture slides nor allow anyone to take pictures of it, and is extremely strict in enforcing this

In high school, reading directly off presentation slides is considered extremely unintelligent, shows that you are unprepared.

Professor doing this is a joke
complete indoctrination

If you're looking for an echo chamber of Professor Lucas' opinions, look no further. Hopefully your ideologies align or she will use whataboutism to discredit your opposing opinion. One example is that she believes Males can participate in Women's professional sports with no more reason than their personal identification. Problematic
philosophy terrorist.

Her lectures have got to be the most boring lecture I've ever attended. She spends the first hour ranting about random topics with bias. She not only does not provide lecture slides but is extremely strict on not taking photos of slides or anything. She grades ridiculously tough and the tutorial quizzes/final exam are quite unfair, pretty bad prof.

Very liberal professor, despite trying to stay nonpolitical in this review, the professor whom I will not even name is extremely liberal and openly critiques other views in class with no problem. Extremely sensitive to student opinion and for some bizarre reason, absolutely does not allow us to take pictures?

A good example of academic censorship.

Michaela is clearly a very intelligent woman. She is inspiring in that regard. Unfortunately, her lectures are riddled with personal bias, which made students with more traditional views very uncomfortable. She has no issue with including obscene personal anecdotes in her lectures. For a class on morals, she seemed to do quite a bit of moralizing.

very picky on the smallest things in lecture and extremely picky on assignment wording. Just overall a very picky person which makes this class extremely unenjoyable. Has apparent PTSD from students plagiarizing. Because of michaela, I am no longer interested in philosphy

prompts for essay is. very obscene. Quite literally asking us to write an essay about nude content under the guise of "moral study".Also very sensitive to student behavior in lecture and makes a big scene about not "plagiarizing", thinking we apparently are all dishonest from the start.N o clear instructions for assignments& extremely picky
Awful lectures. Did not share the lecture notes shown in the class and instead shared a extremely summarized and vague version of it. Did not even allow to take photos of the lecture slides.

Michaela's lectures were decent, only had 2 papers with plenty of time to finish them and a few quizzes which were also easy. My gripe with her teaching style is that she doesn't promote any curiosity or debate. We weren't allowed to see both sides of the debated topics; she forced one opinion onto the class. I wish she promoted critical thinking.

Michaela's lectures were clear and she provided lecture notes. Participation required in tutorial. Quizzes and exam were easy and completely based on the study guide questions. The only issues I had were that the lectures were often posted 2 days late and that the highest anyone got was 90% on the papers (without much justification for lost marks).

Lucas has chosen a terrible lecture format for this course. She has recorded herself reading off of a PDF for an hour every week. The lecture is just a summary of the readings. Overall, the least engaging class ever. Because the quizzes are open book she expects basically a word for word answer from the notes or else you lose heavy marks.

Good reading selection, and you actually learn a ton about moral philosophy in lecture. The papers are difficult to write if you aren't the best writer or aren't acquainted with philosophy papers. Tough marker, actually makes you think and argue concisely. I'd recommend taking this course to anyone, valuable information imo. Not really a GPA boost.

Professor Black has a unique teaching style that some find engaging, others a bit dry. The workload is manageable if you stay on top of the weekly reflections. For test prep, ChatGPT and unstuck AI were a big help.

He's a really good professor who cares about his students and a good lecturer , but you're grade will be mainly decided by your TA's since they are the ones who will mark your papers. The TA's for my classes were were good though

Full of contempt, dismissive and totally allergic to original ideas. Not only does he not have a clue about what he himself is talking, he does not have a clue about what you (as a student) are saying. Fails to understand most of the philosophical concepts; very limited philosophical insight.

Sam Black is a nightmare of a professor. His lectures are unbearably boring, with confusing slides crammed with 70-170 pages of content for a two-hour session. Tutorials are mandatory, weekly reflections are tedious, and your grade depends entirely on your TA. The final exam is poorly structured and doesn't match the course content.

Sam is a very good prof. There's around 1-2 hours of reading a week but they are not super hard. For essays, go to office hours because a lot of the time your arguments are not as strong as you think and the ta's will give you good feedback. One thing is that sam says he's open minded but he in fact very liberal and it will reflect in his lectures.

The lecture notes in this class basically aim to slowly turn you into a far left liberal. I now understand why all of these people in society that have these beliefs have bs degrees like arts, communications ect. They are indoctrinated into believing this nonsense and marked according to it. Shame

Go to class, go to TA's office hours for essay feedback before submitting. It's a GPA booster. the professor said it himself. His final exam is just MCQ with 30 questions, so do the readings! Overall really enjoyed this class!
Hes amazing, make sure to check the reviews under "Samuel Black" becuase they are also about him, and are more accurate in my opinion. Take his classes!!

Best professor I had this semester. Lectures can get boring but if you really lock in they are quite fun. I enjoyed the topics we learned about and my TA was awesome. There are 3 papers and while I had some difficulty writing them, the rubric was clear to follow so it helped me a lot.

I loved Sam Black's class, there was always something interesting in lecture and I was always engaged with the topics. If you're not as interested in the course material your experience would be much different than mine. I enjoyed in class discussions as they did help with understanding the papers we have read. Assignment topics are challenging

Sam's lectures are engaging (albeit, lengthy) and he's passionate about his work. The readings to which he refers in his slides use confusing language, but he does a great job of simplifying them. Don't take this class as a GPA booster; you should genuinely be interested in Philosophy. Papers can be tricky but TAs help a lot. Best prof so far.

Remember: You HAVE to be passionate about PHIL for this class. If not, this class is not for you. Lectures drag on a bit, I'm not a fan of how he formats his slides, & lots of reading to be done. We had 3 papers so get ready. Listen to your TAs for that. Despite that, he has so much personality, & is a cool guy, but his class is just not for me.

You have to write 3 papers in this course.The papers are often on very difficult to argue concepts.What is even worse is that these old papers you use as references are so confusingly written that even reading a sentence 5 times you do not understand what it means. I am saying this as a person born in Canada fluent in English! Torture/Waste of Time

Embarrassing to see him push his beliefs so hard on students and sharing false information. He mentions that Elon Musk never donates any money, but he signed a pledge to donate 99% of his net worth long ago. Also claims that he is a white supremacist?! Calls Trump a fascist too. Only took this as a B-HUM is required. Thank god I'm not a PHIL major.

His lectures dragged on and there are 100+ slides per lecture which are confusing & horribly organized. He's very passionate about what he teaches, but the way he teaches is not for me. Attendance is required as he posts quizzes on Canvas that require a password that changes every class. If you want a GPA booster, this is def not the right class.
overall great prof! just his lectures could get boring. However he wants his students to do well in this course!
He really cares about this course, he is really nice and understanding, and offers a lot of student support.

Sam is one of the best professors ive had because of how kind and caring he is, if you ever need to take a PHIL course for ANY reason - required or not - i'd take one with him. He is clear, kind, respectful, approachable, funny, and engaging. The workload is perfect and won't stress you out. Plus, if you ever need help he will be right there. DO IT

Professor Sam Black is very passionate about the topics we discussed. His lecture slides were confusing as they range from 70-170 slides for a two hour lecture. The slides were overall confusing. No midterm. The final is 30% of our grade, 1 hour long with 30 mc questions, which i dont think suits the structure of our class or content amount.

TAKE THIS CLASS. Sam cares so much about his students, everything is super clear in the syllabus and if he makes any changes he will always make an announcement. He is so approachable and so nice, he goes above and beyond to make sure everyone in the class does well and is comfortable in lectures for difficult topics, and the work is NOT HARD.
Lecture attendance was mandatory but he's a sweet guy who clearly cares about his students and what he teaches.
Great Prof but a ton of reading and lecture material. Clearly enjoys teaching. Mandatory in class quizzes for submission marks.

His lectures are AWFUL, so so hard to follow. Explains concepts using examples and just rambles, never actually gets to the point. Tutorials weren't helpful. Final is 30 question M/C but it's cumulative, confusing, and worth 30% of your grade. Attendance in lecture mandatory and part of your grade.

He's excited to introduce students to the material and lectures reflect that.  Unfortunately pretty disorganized and changes the syllabus and readings every week.

Need to keep on top of the latest versions of all documents because they are considered provisional and will change without notice!  Mandatory attendance by way of passworded quizzes.

Very sweet guy and genuinely great at explaining the topics, however it could get boring at times. Your whole grade depends on your TA tbh since there are 3 papers to do. The final was absolutely crazy hard so do your best people.

Sam is a great prof, tries his best to make le tyres interesting and engaging. However he does send documents each week to read and write a reflection on (between 4-40 pages) which is also easy if you can time manage those and your other assignments. He works well to make it clear what he wants on the papers and only has one cumulative final test

Sam keeps you engaged, however if you aren't interested you will find his lecture boring. THIS IS NOT A GPA BOOSTER. write your reflections, and your papers and you will be fine. Tutorials are mandatory, lecture isn't. Final exam is very similar to his study guide, so follow that, and just know the beliefs of each philosopher and you will be fine

really boring prof. hated going to the lecture even when you dont have to. tutorial is must and there's weekly reflections. THIS CLASS DEPENDS ON YOUR TA. Ik some people who got more marks than me in essays because of the TA.

The material is interesting and the examples that he makes are relevant. Grading criteria for written assignments are clear. However, the lectures were kinda boring, as he just changes his voice to read all the info from slides. Didn't outline what we will be tested on the final exam, had to memorize all slides. Exam is hard and tricky, prepare!!!
he was really good at teaching, had to pay attention but made it fun

I've taken two classes with him so far (unfortunately, because the PHIL department is lacking profs) and I can say I'm not his biggest fan. He provides lecture notes, but they're lengthy Word/PPT documents that are unclear. Rambles on about theory, while not applying it to anything. Assignments and grading are poorly explained and pointless.

Sam is an amazing prof and I would love to take more of his courses. I initially took this class for the writing credit but the topics were so engaging and they really change the way you look at current issues. Sam is good at giving examples to make the concepts clear and the essays are graded fairly.

Sam Black is a very good professor and explains course material well. Philosophy is a topic where you must be open to changing the way you think about issues. Being able to look at a topic objectively from both sides is extremely important if you want to do well in this class. Participate in tutorials! If you don't understand, find out how to!

Professor Black is been my favourite Prof, he loves his work, and is very proud to teach his students about a topic that is a huge part of his life. To receive a good mark in the class you needn't show up to lecture but the first couple topics originally draw you to lecture but you will continue coming after that because his lectures are amazing.
Didn't show up to a single lecture, so I didn't even recognize him at the final exam. However, seems sweet and intelligent. I assume it was an enjoyable class.

Sam made the lectures pretty interesting and did his best to apply examples that would engage the class. The final for this class was pretty tricky but if you study lots you'll be fine. I think he did a great job of teaching the material and I would definitely take another course with him

Interesting topics, but a hard course. There were A LOT of (difficult) readings. He seems like a nice guy, and he can be funny, but I swear I fell asleep in almost every lecture (and the class was only 50 min long!). Don't really need to go to lecture, just do the readings and your papers and you're fine. Not a first year class though...
lecture is pointless. Do the assigned reading, write the essay, go to final, you will do fine. Boring prof.

This prof is really really boring! His class is pointless to attend! The best part is the framing question but after that it goes downhill. One of the hardest first year class as some of the material is difficult. He seems like a really nice guy outside of class though.
He is nice.. very boring material though. Hated it. Useless, and pointless. Your paper mark depends on your TA, I got my final paper reviewed and it went up by 3 letter grades.

I absolutely hated this class but Sam is really good. He managed to make the topics i found really boring sumwhat half-interesting, which is quite the feat. If you like Philosophy, you will love Sam Black.
He's pretty nice and tries to accommodate students' needs for learning. Interesting course.

Lectures were pretty much useless.  Tutorials are on the useless side as well (guess it depends on your ta). The course consists of 3 papers and 1 final. The essays are super hard... first 2 are worth 20%, last essay worth 30% (same as the final). Final was easy compared to essays, just study the lecture notes and you should be fine.

I like the prof, he is very approachable. He does try to clarify things for the students. I enjoyed course content, but it seems a bit hard to get a high mark in this course. Especially the essays--the TA's expectations are slightly diff so you better go see him/her to find out. also, your arguments better be convincing if you want to get those mar

Just finished the exam 4 hours ago.  It was sooo easy.  I had only gone to the first three weeks of classes and just study his course review and some of my own notes (with definitions and MAIN IDEAS of the 8 or 9 philosophers).  Lectures were super boring, but it is alright, exam is easy :)
No Comments

He tries to  be funny, but with little to no avail. His lecture notes are ALWAYS hard to follow and incorrect. He pretty much reads off his notes. If he doesn't he skips what we feel is important. I learned way more in my tutorials because they are clear in tutorials.
She is amazing. Made me want to do a minor in philosophy. Course is heavily curved. If you want to do well make sure you really understand the concepts, go to all tutorials and ask questions!

The MC on the midterm and finals were very tricky but the short answer's were easy. The TA's gave low marks to people on the papers, and never really taught us how to write a good philosophy paper. They always kept telling us that a philosophy paper is different from all the papers you've ever wrote. So, shouldn't they teach you it first?

Jen is a good prof. This was not my first Phil course,I aced 105 and 100W but I have no idea how people (if any) got an A in this class. The average was 72 and was curved to become a B- for everyone. The TA's marking seemed to clump everyone together. I had no idea how to ace assignments or tests and "the right way" was never explained. Frustrating

Recommended if you need a Phil or W class. She's great if you're new to philosophy. Unbiased. Will help you develop your position, whatever it is. Class is about interesting & important modern moral issues. Explains readings clearly. Don't memorize slides, understand them and be able to explain philosophers' positions. Note: gl with TAs :/
Made a nice philosophy course that is usually about Aristotle and various normative ethics into a course about abortion and violent fap material, fabulous

She is a sweet professor. Great explanations and even if you don't do the reading, her lectures help. The TA is absolutely terrible though - if you get Aaron, drop it immediately. He rants too much and just wants to waste time for the sake of it

Had her for Phil 120 and 221. I love her organization. Some philosophy profs have a tendency to get sidetracked in rambles but Jenntypically stays focused. One of my favourite Phil profs. And she's hot.

Took what could have been an awesome class and made it incredibly boring. Her teaching style is dry and hard to stay focused on. We were told multiple times that writing a philosophy paper is different than regular papers yet were not told how to write a good one and then received incredibly low grades. Wish this class had a better prof.

I'm half way through my third year and I would say she is possibly the best professor I've had at SFU! The readings are alright but sometimes a little boring yet she somehow manages to make every lecture extremely interesting! Exams are comprehensive but manageable if you understand everything. I would recommend her a million times over!!!

Jennifer is one of the best profs I have come in contact with so far. Her lectures are never boring and easy to follow. There was always one student who would argue theories, but never once did she get frustrated. She gave you all the readings online, but they weren't necessary because she explained everything so clearly. She made philosophy fun
Lectures are informative. Material was straightforward and comprehensible. Prof was kinda clear with grading criteria. Sometimes you don't know what she's expecting, but the course is easy to pass.

no textbook, all the readings are on canvas.  lectures are really helpful for understanding the readings.  short papers and easy tutorial participation marks. midterm and final both had very tricky multiple choice
Dr. Warriner is AWESOME! I went to every class simply because I love her class!She is really supportive, strongly recommended!
no comments

Knowledgeable Prof. She explains everything in detail. Her class is engaging that she answers students' questions in class. Tests are based on her notes. TA marks everything for her so keep a good relationship with your TA. You don't wanna skip a single class because she is hot and her voice is sweat :)
Friendly teacher ever!But nothing provided on webct..no notes, slides, records..
She's a lovely person who is eager to help. Marking is pretty tough.

He gives pretty good feedback, however, he never provides solid criteria for the papers. The lectures were quite lengthy and got boring at times, but his humour makes it a bit entertaining. Would not take a class with him ever again though. Easy class to BS through.

Super boring course, took it for credit but the professor is nice enough. She didn't have office hours which I didn't like, had to go to my TA for everything. Slides are pretty clear and are posted on canvas, pretty much everything was covered there so no need to attend lectures
Professor Rosenthal is committed to providing an excellent learning environment for her students. Recommended.

Cares very much about her students' success and is understanding about extenuating circumstances. Lecture content and homework is easily accessible and workload itself is easy to manage. Exam was fairly easy as long as you review all the content and follow her criteria.

Chelsea was a fair grader and even let us have a cheat sheet for the final which made it really easy. I did not enjoy the lecture content but she tried her best to make it interesting and engaging. Overall a solid prof.

easy course. dont need to read the readings. just use her power points, she goes everything very clearly. final exam offered a cheat sheet. graded on 2 short essays, participation points from in class worksheet and tutorial, and final exam. light work course. however, we didn't get to know our final grade % as she does not post your grade on canva.

Grading criteria for essays were clear but are marked by TAs so pray you get a lenient TA. Lectures are dry but straightforward summaries of the readings which are appreciated. Final exam was also fair, just study the slides. Overall, good prof, but if you weren't interested in Phil to begin with Chelsea won't change your mind.
Take this course. So easy.

Rosenthal is the best professor I've had this semester. Very understanding and simplifies concepts so they are easy to understand. One of the few teachers I've had that genuinely cares about her students. Hope to take her class again someday.

Good teacher, but talks too much during lectures. Not a big deal if you didn't read the readings for the week as she goes over them during lectures. Weekly discussion assignments are easy and can be done during class, and the papers aren't very hard. Participation during tutorials are good as they can contribute positively to your grade.
Very nice prof and does zoom for lectures that you cant make it to. TAs mark hard but its a W course so papers have to be perfect. Shes a really nice prof.

great prof! very nice and clearly very passionate and knowledgeable about the subject matter! reading heavy but didn't require a textbook which was nice, just articles posted to canvas. very clear criteria. 10/10 would recommend.

Professor Rosenthal is an amazing prof! Although this is a W course, you don't need to worry too much about the readings. Focus on her lectures and PPT, they are really useful and clear, and you can definitely understand the readings from her lec even you're an international student. We only have one final, and it is basic.

She is honestly amazing, super understanding during these pandemic times and is flexible with assignments. However theres a lot of writing in this class and most is marked by the T.A. Beware half of your grade in the class is based off the T.A marks and tutorials.

Lkes talking a lot in lectures and encourages participation. for the class in general its pretty chill, i didn't do any readings and i still got a good grade. Bruno emphasizes that because this is a 100 level course, you aren't expected to know any philosophy writing styles so if you follow the same format for every paper you will do good.

Bruno was an amazing professor. He worked hard at making sure everyone understood what was going on and answering questions. He gave very clear explanations and instructions for any of the assignments. The mc final was ROUGH though.

Bruno was an amazing prof that was clearly passionate about the class. Reading could be pretty tough but he explained them fairly well. The papers were marked tough but my TA gave great feedback on them. Although I enjoyed the class it is definitely not the GPA booster I thought it would be.

Good prof, talks about some interesting stuff in class. A few assignments with a good amount of reading. Papers can be somewhat difficult if you don't completely get the readings and the final was pretty straightforward but relies on you doing the readings. Overall, Bruno's a kind and caring prof.

Solid choice for a professor but the lectures were quite boring.The readings and essay prompts were not easy to understand. Final exam was difficult, so don't take this course as a GPA booster. Class average for papers in my tutorial section was a C+.
He was good but TA was not great. He cut marks everywhere, thought it was a GPA booster but turned out to be otherwise. Recommended if no other option.

professor Guindon is amazing, he's a great lecturer and the readings he assigns are actually interesting. He seems passionate when he teaches and I genuinely enjoyed doing the assignments. Watch out for the TAs tho some of them are tough graders and there is generally no consistency between how each of them grades assignments. Would take again
Professor Guindon was a great lecturer. Essays were difficult to get good grades on. He was always open to questions after class. The final exam was fair.

I love Bruno's lectures. Make sure you complete the readings because they are hard to understand. My TA was a gem. Remember that you're not arguing about your view, you're discussing if the paper makes philosophical sense. A challenging class for me who never took a Phil class, but constantly reviewing the papers & slides is rewarding at the end.

Bruno is a great prof however the TA's will make or break this course for you. There are discrepancies between what each TA thinks is the right responses to the prompts for the papers which can make it hard. Keep up with readings and memorize major points for the final. There is no help from bruno when you work on the papers or specific prompts.

Great prof! No textbook required, but the readings provided by the prof are sometimes hard to understand. Lectures and topics and interesting. 3 papers + 1 final exam. Papers are a bit tough. Exam is not too bad as long as you study all the readings. Make sure to keep up w/ readings every week so you dont fall and read 26 readings before the final.

Do not take this class unless you want to drop your GPA. The TA's mark very hard on the three papers that total 60% of the final grade. The topics are quite boring and very hard to read as some modules had up to 25 pages of small dense writing. The final exam was cumulative and expected that you knew every detail of the readings.

Overall, Bruno is a very good, understanding and accommodating prof. He summarizes the readings during the lecturers, so you dont really need to read them (I never did except for when I wrote my papers on that particular topic). He posts his slides, so its definitely possible to do well without attending the lecturers. Solid class overall.

Make sure you DO THE READING!!! So many people had a false sense of security reading one paper for their own essays and disregarding the rest. These SAME people PANICKED for the final. Otherwise, the papers/final are fairly straightforward, but like others have mentioned, TAs make or break your grade. Once again: DO THE READING.

Entertaining lecturer for PHIL120W. Lots of reading, but it isn't mandatory, only need to read specific ones for your paper (and review for final exam). Beware all papers are marked by your TA, so they matter heavily in your grade. For instance, the whole class average for one paper was 10% higher than my TA's three tutorials sections. Recommended

Professor Guindon is a total gem. This is the 2nd philosophy class I have ever taken but he's a great guy and his lectures are always super intriguing and easy to understand. If you can, definitely recommend taking this class with him!

Took it Winter 2020 right before lockdown. His lectures were never boring and he would try to find ways to engage the class. Midterm ended up being cancelled due to Covid so grade was based off of 2 papers with drafts, 1 final paper, tutorial participation, and a take home final. As long as you do the readings, you'll do fine in the class

Absolutely zero consideration for student's mental health or stress. Does not believe in practicing any leniency whatsoever. Would not recommend any classes with him at all. Save your grade and take the course with any other professor.

The prof is well-prepared for each lecture and his class is really makes me engaged. The paper is not very hard and the final exam is fair (he has already given us paper topic and we can prepare them in advance). : )

Sometimes people stir up a ruckus in class because it's philosophy and the topics are grounds for open debate in the middle lecture, amirite? He takes the students' personalities in stride, doesn't really mind it that much when people get offensive. Able to calm people down. Don't say anything "intuitive" or obvious or else you get a look.
Bruno is a good speaker and his lecture slides are pretty easy to understand. The marking for the papers is kinda subjective and I'm not sure if it's because I got a bad TA or not.
Bruno was very passionate during lecture and was able to clarify concepts clearly using examples. Interesting course content and really makes you think.

Bruno would be a solid choice. Hilariously crazy guy though, I was talking to him about meat-eating, and he straight up said to me as an utilitarian that there are be no difference in killing/eating a human than killing/eating a pig if you were stuck on an island with no food since animals and humans are equal. I disagreed. Besides that, good prof.

Going to lecture is useless, he emails all the lecture notes and babbles on in lecture. Skipped two major units (4 weeks) because he wasn't comfortable teaching them (Terrorism and Torture). Extended Abortion and Euthanasia way too long and TAs did not hold their marking to criteria.

Dr. Tiffany is an overall good professor, but his lectures can be a bit confusing as he adds so much  information, including examples and concepts into 30-50 slides a class. It can be tough to understand everything the first time and not get tired of some of the topics. The final exam was worth 30% and it covered information from 9 weeks.

Professor Tiffany was a pretty decent prof, clear and direct at explaining things. However his lectures at times tended to be boring and a little dry and it caused me to lose focus. He was very helpful at answering additional questions any students had. One complaint is the info about papers was often minimal until before they were due.

Dr. Tiffany really cares about his students and his teaching style is very engaging. The readings are not too challenging if you spend time to really understand them, and if there are any confusions, Dr. Tiffany simplifies the readings during lectures. The only thing I didn't enjoy about this class was the grading. The final was also fair.

Really solid prof, engaging lectures, and explains well. Assignments are fair/made sense but I'd agree that the grading is a little atrocious. Not much feedback on assignments and they mark on the harder side,I took the little feedback they gave, applied it to my paper and somehow got lower the second time? good thing i cooked on the final.

wouldn't recommend taking a writing course with this professor who made this first year course challenging. The average on the final exam was only 60%. Grading was unfair. Get ready to read every week! The exam questions were literally based on both assigned readings and lecture slides.  97% is A+???? Phil 120 is not a GPA booster.

Evan's a nice guy, you can tell he cares about the subject and his students. However, the grading system is absolutely atrocious. For example, you need to get 77.08% just for a B-. I got 22/24 on an assignment and only got an A- and got 20/24 on another assignment worth 20% and got a B-. I'm praying that he'll eventually just scale or curve.

He's definitely an engaged professor, it's easy to see that he loves what he does, and the lectures themselves are interesting. That being said, you're graded on 6 things total. 10% for skill 1, 20 for skill 2, 30 for 3/4, and 30 for the final. 10 Goes to participation. So if you don't do too well on more than one thing, you're in trouble.

I really enjoyed the course I thought It was great.

My only gripe is the final project, worth 30%, I believed I produced my best college level essay, and I only got a B-, while the other projects with lower weight, I believe were pretty dogsh*t, got a literal 100%?? hello?

Final grade was based on a variety of things and grading criteria was reasonable. Tiffany's classes were always super interesting. Probably, the best prof I've had in my time at SFU. There was some confusion surrounding some assignments with the TAs themselves being unsure of what the assignment was about, but that's all.
Very easy class. No midterms but there is a final. There were only 3 papers to write and a few small reflections. Lectures are easy to understand

There's legit only 3 assignments in this class and the material isn't hard. although lectures aren't mandatory, should probably attend because the slides he posts only have photos. his assignment criteria is worded confusingly, even the TA was unsure when we were asking her questions. Overall easy course tho

Chill and easy class.The weekly quizzes are actually quite helpful and the assignments are all pretty simple. His lectures are interesting and he's good at explaining everything. The final was really easy and was mostly based off the weekly quiz questions. Only complaint is the mandatory tutorial attendance which is worth 5% of the total grade.

Evan's lectures are great because he presents them as a story. However, my one complaint is that sometimes the story could be presented better to reduce confusion (the order in which the information is presented). 
Another notable aspect of his teaching is that the grading scheme is solid.

Honestly the easiest class I've ever taken. There's lots of assignments but they're relatively simple and, at least with my TA, were graded kindly. Dr. Tiffany's lectures are super engaging and he's great at explaining the readings. Papers were also straightforward and we had a couple options on what to write for two of them. Overall W class

Gives a weekly quiz and 200-500 word prompts all based on lecture (super easy if you go to class and understand content). There are 3 big assignments (skill 1, skill 2, skill 3), also super easy. Final was take home and just copy pasting 5 of your weekly prompts. The other half of final was based off of quizzes, so only revise those. Great class!

I really enjoyed this class and prof Tiffany. There are weekly quizzes based off the lecture, and weekly 250-500 word write ups about the readings. There are 3 big writing assignments (40%), and a half take-home (20%) half in-person final (20%). Overall this class was a fun course to take, some weeks are boring but most weeks are very interesting!

Expect a LOT of assignments, minimum 3 a week: Quizzes, weekly papers, heavy readings and 1,000+ word papers all due within the same week. Evan is very sweet but the TA's are so hard and make everything much more complicated and very minimally help- They are all briefed on how to give help.... which isn't the best as they did not offer a lot ofhelp

A really kind and caring prof who really cares about his students. He would answer your questions patiently and can fix quiz marks if the question is confusing. The course is straightforward and clear (3 papers, 12 quizzes, 12 pass/fail assignments and one final) and there is no time limit when doing the quizzes.

Evan is a great prof. If you do the readings and attend lecture, the class will not be difficult. Weekly quizzes and assignments, but not hard if you've attended lecture. You know exactly how the grading works which is great. Took this class as an elective and would highly recommend. You cannot get away with doing the bare minimum, but still easy.
Great teacher, easy class. Attend lecture and pay attention and you will do fine on assignments and quizzes

I'm taking this class as an elective, but I genuinely enjoy it so much. I look forward to class every week, and the assignments do take effort but they're not too difficult! I would definitely recommend taking this class with Prof Tiffany.
He is supper nice, knowledgeable, and easy to reach professor.
Single Handedly caused me to decide to minor in philosophy. An engaging lecturer, fair grader, clear, nice, and knowledgeable.

Prof Tiffany was super nice and you could tell that he cared more about your understanding of concepts rather than marks, not to mean that you would get a bad grade, but you could tell he was very knowledgeable and passionate about his lectures. If anything he is a bit too kind for a prof. TA's were helpful and respectful but a little inconsistent.
No midterm, and he gave a lot of time for the MC final. A very easy-going professor and very helpful TA's as well.

Evan Tiffany is by far the most amazing professor I've had. Amazing lectures - he inserts a lot of jokes and cultural references to make it easier for us to understand. There are quite a few papers and writing assignments every week, and the grading is rather tough.

Although the concepts of this course were relatively new to me, Dr. Tiffany made everything easy to follow by explaining the content in-depth while also maintaining an easy-to-follow and engaging environment. The marking was fair and there was a sufficient amount of feedback as well. The exam was fairly easy, but the wording was quite tricky.

Overall, decent class. You are marked on three papers, participation in tutorial, and worksheets. Worksheets are not hard, they're marked purely on effort. Papers are marked a bit harder. The average for the first paper was 67%. You can do well if you discuss with Evan or the TA ahead of time to know what they're looking for. Lectures aren't bad.

The last Phil course I took I dropped because it was soooo boring, but I needed one for my degree so I chose this one. I'm so glad I did!! Prof Tiffany was super engaging & very passionate about the content. I didn't get a great grade on my first paper, but the TA I had (Daniel) gave great feedback :)

Professor Tiffany is one of the most enthusiastic people I have ever come across when it comes to Philosophy. You can tell by his lectures he genuinely loves what he does, and is extremely passionate talking about it. Grading is difficult in this course, but it gets easier after the first assignment, since you'll now know what to expect from TA's.

Lectures are clear and entertaining, making difficult topics understandable. This is a W course so there's a ton of writing, but the criteria are super clear and you shouldn't have any problem if you refer to them. No textbook, readings provided online for free which is nice, but the articles can be quite lengthy and dry.

Evan has been a real lifesaver this semester. Phil 120w is a really great course and the way he teaches is super engaging. He provides our weekly readings (the BEST!) and makes a great effort to balance synchronous/asynchronous class time. The assignments are also really great as they're all about improving on your past work.

Evan is fantastic!! my favourite prof this semester, he is so engaging and clearly explains and elaborates on material. The course material itself is pretty interesting and Evan applies it in easy to understand ways and has cute drawings on his slides. not a taxing class at all! definitely take it, I wish he had more lower level classes

This guy should have a wayyyy higher rating IMO. Really good at getting information across and keeping content interesting. Super clear about what he wants and makes the asynchronous lectures engaging. You really don't have to do the readings for this class, as long as you pay attention in lecture. Highly suggest this class w/ Evan!

Probably the best professor I've had so far. The lectures in his class are amazing and keep you way more entertained than any other class I've taken. I would love to take another class with this prof. He's really funny and helpful. For this class though the grading is all done by the TA and they are super tough and unfair, so the class is hard.

Evan was amazing, his lectures were entertaining! PRO tip get super close with your Teacher Assistant and be engaged and you'll get a stellar grade. Ask to meet privately and discuss assignment to make sure you understand exactly what they're looking for AND to ket them know you care about your grade. Be open minded and think, its philosophy

Thoroughly enjoyed his Phil120W class. There were weekly worksheets, two papers, and a final. The lectures and the topics that were covered were really intriguing. The final is a breeze as long as you pay attention during lectures and tutorial. Overall great prof.

Evan Tiffany is a fun professor who provides an engaging lecture using real-world examples. Tutorials are mandatory to attend for participation. Almost all of the assignments are marked by the TA's so the grading scheme can be unfair and may be inconsistent. Final exam was okay if you understood all the lectures and showed up to the tutorials.

Not sure why is everyone upset about marking. Although I might have had a nice TA, I thought the assignment marking was very straightforward to the point. And Evan let us know all the points that need to be included in the assignment and papers. He literally make an outline for your paper in the class so you don't really need to use your brain.

prof explains things well and I actually enjoyed his class BUT, his TA's have serious issues. they don't have clear grading criteria's for the paper so essentially TA's make up whatever mark they want to. had to argue and show that I did include the thing they asked for then they would be like "oh my bad" & fix it. shouldnt have to prove our marks.

This course is extremely interesting, however the marking is so inconsistent it's crazy. The TA's in this class will determine your mark, not your actual work. I never met Evan, but he seems like a great person and prof. I just can not get over how unjustified my marks were throughout the term, all because my TA marks different than others...??

I barely met the guy, but Dr. Tiffany is nice; However, his lectures are not as clear as he thinks it is, which makes it really hard to complete the papers. If he's going to have a 2 hr office hour, he might as well change it to an actual lecture. There's no clear criteria, so your grade is up to what your ta thinks you deserve.

Evan seems to be a great guy. Class isn't too hard as I read non of the reading and still did pretty solid on my papers. Breaks down how to write a proper philosophy paper and makes it an easy process. I would defiantly take this class if you have a hard schedule and need something easier. The only thing is TA's can be inconsistent with marks.

Awesome prof. Because it was online, students didn't have any mandatory meetings with him, as all tutorials were led by TA's and his lectures were pre-recorded. The only problem of this class were the TA's. None of their decisions matched, which frustrated a lot of students. Overall, though, Tiffany is awesome if you get the chance to talk to him.

Evan himself seems like a really nice guy and he tries to make the lectures entertaining. TA's mark a bit hard for a first year class and are not super clear about how they are giving them out, but overall a pretty fun class.

there are several readings each week usually and they are long and dry and boring but that is what this class is about. he tries to make it a fun and interesting class for the topics covered. you have to go to lecture because there is iclicker participation. no midterm, only a final and it is quite hard.

This class was a really good introduction to philosophy and helps you to understand the basics of writing and reconstructing a good argument. The testing format is a little odd as there is only one, being the final, but as long as you do well on your papers it's not too big of a deal. Make sure you understand the key concepts.
He is an amazing prof who is passionate and knowledgable, if you ever watch "The Good Place" he is legit Michael ! Would 10/10 recommend.

Evan Tiffany is a great Prof to have for this class. PHIL 120W is based off many papers and Dr. Tiffany breaks them down clearly for you to understand. I enjoyed taking the class with him. He is very caring, engaging and funny. We had 3 papers and a final. Papers were simple and topics taught in this class were very interesting. Great Prof!!!

First time taking a class with Dr. Tiffany, and it was amazing! He is honestly one of the most kind and caring profs I've had so far. Super approachable, super caring, and really good at breaking down complicated papers. I would highly recommend taking this course with him. The course itself is reading and lecture heavy, but he makes it easier.

It is my first time taking a course with Dr. Tiffany. I found his lectures very intriguing, and he is very good at explaining complicated concepts and arguments. For a writing course, I found the structure and assignments of the papers very fair. TA was awesome which helped as well. Overall a very enjoyable class, good for a W credit!

NIce guy who's really passionate about what he's talking about, however, the way he talks is sooo boring. Lectures are important because of clicker questions, but they are BORING! my TA sucked but my friends TA was good, they mark papers VERY hard. The lecture slides get posted and they have useful info on them.

Evan was great. This was my first semester at SFU and I thought he was amazing. He loves to show tv shows during his class (Simpsons, South Park, etc....). 120W ranks right up there with the most thought provoking classes I have EVER had. Do your readings, ask questions, don't make assumptions, and challenge YOUR assumptions.

Lectures are kind of dry and boring, mainly due to prof's style of speech delivery. Frequent videos. Uses his own textbook, so it's free. Material on the surface appears difficult, but with some thought involved, this course can be very straightforward and simple. His study guides prepares you well for the exams, as it is very revealing.
awesome lecture. clear understanding and explanation of theories.

Good teacher, vey engaging and his lectures are very well delivered. Papers are relatively easy. However.... HIS MIDTERM IS SO F&*#NG DUMB.. each multiple choice is 4 marks.. which is ridiculous. 1 Midterm question is worth almost as much as half of a short answer (1 paragraph answer)..... I still recommend him, but complain about the exam grading.

Owen definitely cared a lot about his students and he really put effort into his lectures to make them more enjoyable. He chose to do Aristotle and Plato philosophy. If you don't read some of the books you probably won't do well on the essays. His tests were easy and definitely go to tutorials it really helped with the understanding of material.
